docs.title: What is Symnix?
docs.text:
Symnix is a platform that makes it easy to setup, manage and secure web applications on your own environment. It doesn't matter which provider you host your server with because you do not need to install a client on your system.

You can install web apps directly from your browser with Symnix. In the meantime, Symnix automates all the task required for the installation, certificate management or backups.

Symnix offers a centralized way to organize users or organizations through granular permission management.

docs.title: Why Symnix?
docs.text: We offer a wide range of different services that can be deployed. To start a deployment, you only need to specify a target host and define a few variables. Our application then takes over the deployment of the desired application. Check the Getting Started ⧉ section to deploy your first application.

docs.title: Development Status
docs.text: Symnix is being actively developed by our team.

docs.title: Can I install multiple services on one server?
docs.text: Yes you can! As long as your server has enough hardware available.

docs.title: How does Symnix charge me?
docs.text: Our pricing model is open and transparent. You pay the price you see without hidden costs.

docs.title: Which operating systems do you support?
docs.text: We currently support Ubuntu 22.04 and 24.04, Debian 11 and 12 and Rocky Linux 9. Other operating systems may also work, but are not currently being tested.

docs.title: Where can I deploy my services?
docs.text: You can deploy your services anywhere as long as you have access to the server and the server is reachable from the internet. It doesn't matter if it's a VM in the cloud or even your own server at home.

docs.title: You have not listed the service I need.
docs.text: If we don't have the service you need listed yet, you are welcome to use our template ⧉ to create new services, or contact us via email if you don't have a GitHub account.

docs.title: Where do you store my data?
docs.text: Symnix stores your account data in the EU in Germany, protected by some of the strictest privacy laws in the world. You can visit our Privacy policy site ⧉ to learn more about this topic. Your application data is hosted on your own server, in the country or city which you have selected when deploying your server.

docs.title: What happens with my services if I unsubscribe?
docs.text: We're sorry to see you go. Nevertheless, all services will remain deployed on your host in the same version as you deployed them with your active subscription. However, you cannot deploy new versions of your services or make changes via the Symnix application.

docs.title: Where can I view upcoming features?
docs.text: As part of our transparent strategy, we have created a roadmap ⧉ where we share planned features. Of course, customers can also influence this feature list and its priority to deliver a product that fits best.

docs.title: Can't find the answer you're looking for?
docs.text: Reach out to our developer team ⧉ to get in touch.

docs.title: Open Source Philosophy
docs.text:
Symnix is built on a foundation of open source technologies that power the modern web. We recognize the immense value these projects bring to the development community and strive to give back in meaningful ways.

While the core code of Symnix remains closed-source for now, we are committed to supporting the open source ecosystem in several ways:

docs.title: Sharing:
docs.text: We open source selected tools, libraries, and utilities developed by our team that can be helpful to others. By making these resources publicly available, we aim to contribute to the broader developer community and enable innovation beyond our own platform. You can explore our open source contributions here ⧉.

docs.title: Collaborating with the Community:
docs.text:
We try to actively contribute to some of the open source projects that we depend on by submitting merge requests, reporting bugs, and helping to improve features. This collaboration not only strengthens the tools we rely on but also ensures their continued success for everyone.

Our commitment to open source reflects our belief in fostering a culture of collaboration and innovation. We encourage others to engage with open source, whether by contributing code, supporting maintainers, or simply sharing knowledge.

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
1. Make sure you've read the getting started guide.
  2. Looked for an answer in the frequently asked questions.
  3. Read existing issues ⧉
  4. Created a new service request if a service that you need is missing
  5. Report a bug, or request another feature ⧉.
